datalib package

Submodules

datalib.analysis module

Functions for regression and data analysis.

datalib.analysis.linear_regression(X, y, return_metrics=False)[source]

Perform linear regression.

Parameters:

  • X – Feature matrix.

  • y – Target vector.

  • return_metrics – If True, return model metrics (default: False).

datalib.analysis.multiple_linear_regression(X, y, return_metrics=False)[source]

Perform multiple linear regression.

Parameters:

  • X – Feature matrix.

  • y – Target vector.

  • return_metrics – If True, return model metrics (default: False).

datalib.analysis.polynomial_regression(X, y, degree, return_metrics=False)[source]

Perform polynomial regression.

Parameters:

  • X – Feature matrix.

  • y – Target vector.

  • degree – Polynomial degree.

  • return_metrics – If True, return model metrics (default: False).

datalib.data_processing module

Functions for data loading, cleaning, and preprocessing.

datalib.data_processing.encode_categorical(df, column)[source]

Encode a categorical column as integers.

Parameters:

  • df – DataFrame containing the data.

  • column – Column to encode.

datalib.data_processing.fill_missing_values(df, column, method='mean')[source]

Fill missing values in a column.

Parameters:

  • df – DataFrame containing the data.

  • column – Column to fill.

  • method – Method to fill values (“mean”, “median”, “mode”).

datalib.data_processing.load_csv(file_path)[source]

Load a CSV file into a DataFrame.

Parameters:

file_path (str) – Path to the CSV file.

datalib.data_processing.normalize_column(df, column)[source]

Normalize a column in the DataFrame.

Parameters:

  • df – DataFrame containing the data.

  • column – Column to normalize.

datalib.data_processing.scale_data(df, columns)[source]

Scale numerical columns.

Parameters:

  • df – DataFrame containing the data.

  • columns – List of columns to scale.

datalib.reinforcement module

Functions for reinforcement learning algorithms.

datalib.reinforcement.basic_q_learning(environment, episodes, alpha, gamma, epsilon=0.1)[source]

Implement the Q-learning algorithm.

Parameters:

  • environment – The RL environment.

  • episodes – Number of episodes to train.

  • alpha – Learning rate.

  • gamma – Discount factor.

  • epsilon – Exploration rate.

datalib.reinforcement.sarsa(environment, episodes, alpha, gamma, epsilon=0.1)[source]

Implement the SARSA algorithm.

Parameters:

  • environment – The RL environment.

  • episodes – Number of episodes to train.

  • alpha – Learning rate.

  • gamma – Discount factor.

  • epsilon – Exploration rate.

datalib.statistics module

Functions for performing statistical analysis.

datalib.statistics.calculate_mean(data)[source]

Calculate the mean of a dataset.

Parameters:

data – Array-like dataset.

datalib.statistics.calculate_median(data)[source]

Calculate the median of a dataset.

Parameters:

data – Array-like dataset.

datalib.statistics.calculate_mode(data)[source]

Calculate the mode of a dataset.

Parameters:

data – Array-like dataset.

datalib.statistics.calculate_pearson_correlation(x, y)[source]

Calculate the Pearson correlation coefficient.

Parameters:

  • x – First dataset.

  • y – Second dataset.

datalib.statistics.calculate_spearman_correlation(x, y)[source]

Calculate the Spearman rank correlation coefficient.

Parameters:

  • x – First dataset.

  • y – Second dataset.

datalib.statistics.perform_chi_square_test(table)[source]

Perform a chi-square test.

Parameters:

table – Contingency table for the test.

datalib.statistics.perform_t_test(data1, data2, alternative='two-sided')[source]

Perform a t-test.

Parameters:

  • data1 – First dataset.

  • data2 – Second dataset.

  • alternative – Type of test (“two-sided”, “greater”, “less”).

datalib.supervised module

Functions for supervised machine learning models.

datalib.supervised.train_decision_tree(X, y, max_depth=None)[source]

Train a Decision Tree classifier.

Parameters:

  • X – Feature matrix.

  • y – Target vector.

  • max_depth – Maximum depth of the tree.

datalib.supervised.train_knn(X, y, n_neighbors=5, weights='uniform')[source]

Train a k-Nearest Neighbors (k-NN) classifier.

Parameters:

  • X – Feature matrix.

  • y – Target vector.

  • n_neighbors – Number of neighbors (default: 5).

  • weights – Weight function (“uniform” or “distance”).

datalib.supervised.train_random_forest(X, y, n_estimators=100)[source]

Train a Random Forest classifier.

Parameters:

  • X – Feature matrix.

  • y – Target vector.

  • n_estimators – Number of trees in the forest (default: 100).

datalib.unsupervised module

Functions for unsupervised learning algorithms.

datalib.unsupervised.perform_gaussian_mixture(X, n_components)[source]

Perform Gaussian Mixture Modeling.

Parameters:

  • X – Feature matrix.

  • n_components – Number of mixture components.

datalib.unsupervised.perform_kmeans(X, n_clusters, random_state=42)[source]

Perform k-means clustering.

Parameters:

  • X – Feature matrix.

  • n_clusters – Number of clusters.

  • random_state – Random seed.

datalib.unsupervised.perform_pca(X, n_components)[source]

Perform Principal Component Analysis (PCA).

Parameters:

  • X – Feature matrix.

  • n_components – Number of components to retain.

datalib.visualization module

Functions for creating various data visualizations.

datalib.visualization.plot_bar(data, x, y, title='Bar Chart', color='blue')[source]

Create a bar plot.

Parameters:

  • data – DataFrame containing the data.

  • x – Column name for the x-axis.

  • y – Column name for the y-axis.

  • title – Title of the chart (default: “Bar Chart”).

  • color – Bar color (default: “blue”).

datalib.visualization.plot_correlation_matrix(data, title='Correlation Matrix', cmap='coolwarm')[source]

Create a correlation matrix heatmap.

Parameters:

  • data – DataFrame containing numerical data.

  • title – Title of the heatmap (default: “Correlation Matrix”).

  • cmap – Colormap for the heatmap (default: “coolwarm”).

datalib.visualization.plot_histogram(data, column, bins=10, title='Histogram', color='green')[source]

Create a histogram.

Parameters:

  • data – DataFrame containing the data.

  • column – Column to plot.

  • bins – Number of bins (default: 10).

  • title – Title of the chart (default: “Histogram”).

  • color – Bar color (default: “green”).

datalib.visualization.plot_scatter(data, x, y, title='Scatter Plot', color='red')[source]

Create a scatter plot.

Parameters:

  • data – DataFrame containing the data.

  • x – Column name for the x-axis.

  • y – Column name for the y-axis.

  • title – Title of the chart (default: “Scatter Plot”).

  • color – Point color (default: “red”).

Module contents

Initialize the datalib package.

This package includes various modules for data visualization, analysis, processing, statistical operations, supervised learning, unsupervised learning, and reinforcement learning.

Modules: - visualization: Functions for plotting and visualizations. - analysis: Functions for regression and analysis. - data_processing: Functions for loading, cleaning, and preprocessing data. - statistics: Functions for statistical analysis. - supervised: Functions for supervised machine learning models. - unsupervised: Functions for unsupervised learning methods. - reinforcement: Functions for reinforcement learning algorithms.
